title: 106_hr2698
content: The Act is titled the "New Workers for Economic Growth Act" and includes provisions for H-1B nonimmigrant workers, specifically regarding authorized admissions of H-1B workers. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to set annual limitations on the number of aliens admitted, with specific numbers for fiscal years 2000-2002 and subsequent years. Additionally, an exemption from the annual limitation is provided for certain aliens. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to exempt certain nonimmigrant aliens from numerical limitations based on their education level and employment status. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to exempt certain nonimmigrant aliens who have attained a bachelor's degree or higher and are employed at an institution of higher education from numerical limitations. Elimination of earnings penalty on senior citizens who continue to work after reaching retirement age. Elimination of earnings penalty for senior citizens working after reaching retirement age by amending Section 203 of the Social Security Act to adjust the retirement age definition and exempt amount calculations. The amendment eliminates the special exempt amount for individuals who have reached retirement age by adjusting the retirement age definition and exempt amount calculations in Section 203 of the Social Security Act. The amendment modifies the exempt amount in the Social Security Act, removing the special exempt amount for individuals at retirement age and adjusting calculations. The amendment repeals the basis for computing the special exempt amount in the Social Security Act and makes additional conforming amendments to eliminate redundant references to retirement age. The amendment modifies provisions related to widow's or widower's insurance benefits and makes conforming amendments to determine the amount of increase on account of delayed retirement under the Social Security Act. The amendment modifies provisions related to widow's or widower's insurance benefits and makes conforming amendments to determine the amount of increase on account of delayed retirement under the Social Security Act. The second sentence of section 223(d)(4) of the Act is amended to include amendments from the Senior Citizens' Right to Work Act of 1996 and the New Workers for Economic Growth Act. The effective date for these changes is for taxable years beginning after December 31, 1999.
